document.docAuthor: Oliveira, Fábio G. L., Cipola, Nikolas G. & Almeida, Eduardo A. B.
document.docTitle: Salina serrana Oliveira¹ & Cipola² & Almeida¹ 2020, sp.n.
document.masterDocTitle: Systematics and biogeography of Salina MacGillivray (Collembola: Entomobryoidea), with emphasis on the species groups in the New World

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Systematics and biogeography of Salina MacGillivray (Collembola: Entomobryoidea), with emphasis on the species groups in the New World

subSubSection.paragraph: Body and legs with blue spots; Ant I with 7 mac; cephalic groove with smooth and ciliate chaetae; Th II–Abd I with 1, 2, 2 central mac, respectively; Abd III with 2 lateral mac ( pm6 , p6 ); Abd IV with 10 central mac ( A3 , A4 and A5 present, A3p sometimes absent) and 10 lateral mac; collophore with 13 anterior, 4 posterior and 20 lateral flap chaetae; trochanteral organ with 13 spine-like chaetae; manubrial plate with 2 chaetae.

subSection.paragraph:
Holotype ♂ on slide (COLLE 046/INPA): Brazil , São Paulo , São Luiz do Paraitinga municipality, State Park of “Serra do Mar”, 23°19’27.1”S , 45°05’38.4”W , Atlantic Forest ,
1012 m
,
22.ix.2010
, Malaise-trap , NW Perioto & team coll
.
Paratypes on slides (COLLE 046A-E/INPA): 5 ♀ and 11 in alcohol, same data as holotype
.

19 specimens in alcohol (INPA): Brazil , São Paulo , São Paulo municipality, fragment of “Instituto Butantan”, 23°33’59”S , 46°43’15”W , Atlantic forest ,
776m
,

-

, Pitfall-trap in tree, JL Chavari coll.

4 specimens in alcohol (MZUSP/AM0032): Santo André municipality, Rebio Paranapiacaba , 23°46’46”S , 46°18’29”W , Atlantic forest ,

844 m
,
23.viii.2010
, Malaisetrap , NW Perioto and team coll
.

subSubSection.paragraph: Total length (head + trunk) of holotype 2.08 mm. Specimens pale white with dark blue pigments on Ant I–IV, strongly on anterior head, intersegmental areas of antenna, posterior and laterally on Th III–Abd II; irregular blue spots on the Abd III–V; inner side of legs with a distal spot on femora and two spots in tibiotarsi (one basal and one subapical). Eyepatches black ( Figure 9G ).

Head. Ant I dorsally with 7 mac and 6 basal spiny smooth mic ( Figure 10G ) Posterior labial chaetotaxy series ‘CG’ with 7 ciliate chaetae (
CG 1–2, CG 3e
,
CG 4
,
CG 6– 7
) and 4 smooth mic (
CG 3
,
CG 5–5e
,
CG 7e
); series ‘PLM’ with 2 ciliate chaetae (
PLM 1–2
); series ‘PLE’ with 2 ciliate chaetae (
PLE 1–2
); lateral side with about 26 ciliate chaetae ( Figure 11G ).

Dorsal chaetotaxy. Th II with 1 ‘m’ mac ( m7 ) and 1 ‘p’ mac ( p3 ). Th III with 1 ‘m’ mac ( m7 ), and 2 ‘p’ mac ( p2–3) ( Figure 12G ). Abd I with 2 ‘p’ mac ( m3 , m4 ) ( Figure 13G ). Abd III with 1 ‘m’ mac ( pm6 ), and 1 ‘p’ mac ( p6 ) ( Figure 14C ). Abd IV with 5–6 ‘A’ mac ( A1 , A3–A6 ), A3p present or absent; 1 ‘Ae’ mac ( Ae1 ); 3 ‘B’ mac ( B3–5 ); 1 ‘Be’ mac ( Be1 ); 1 ‘C’ mac ( C1) ; 4 ‘E’ mac ( E1-4 ); 3 ‘F’ mac ( F1–F3 ); 2 ‘Fe’ mac ( Fe1–2 ); posterior side with 3 sens type IV ( ps and two unnamed) ( Figure 14F ). Abd V with 3 ‘a’ mac ( a0 , a3 , a5 ), a3 present or absent; 3 ‘m’ mac ( m2–3 , m5 ); and 1 ‘p’ mac ( p4 ) ( Figure 15F ).
Refers to locality where the species was found, “Serra do Mar” (Sea Mountain Range) in São Paulo state , Brazil .

See remarks of
S. brasiliana
sp.n.
and
S. hamadae
sp.n.
For additional information, refer to Table 2 .
